properties.abstract: The entire project "Gardens gateways" symbolizes the opening of the CAT on its environment. properties.abstract: The city of Metz purchased this garden in 1866 to the Baroness of the sword, to make a botanical garden. properties.abstract: Historically, the forest has been source of food for men and animals. At a time where agriculture did not yet meet the needs of all, the forest provided a vital daily supplement (chestnut, Acorn, Apple, mushrooms, ripe...). properties.abstract: Villers was in 1581 a small Lordship with dependencies. Expanded over the centuries (16th-19th century), it became the current grand mansion. Owners comment on the home furnished and inhabited, the decorative arts over the centuries by relying on the family patrimony. Temporary exhibitions to theme. Park created in the 18th century and then enlarged and redeveloped during the 19th and 20th centuries.

properties.abstract: The gardens of Etretat,... a magical place on the upstream Cliff at Etretat, with an exceptional view on the famous needle. Combining poetically landscape art and land-art sculptures, the gardens seem to be there forever. It's Mrs. Thébault, famous actress of the beginning of the 20th century, close friend of Claude Monet, himself amateur of beautiful gardens, who decides to plant the first tree on this virgin territory. Resolutely avant-garde, the original spirit of the place has been kept [...]
